intro: Hydrophyllum atranthum, commonly known as blackstem aster, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its dark green, often hairy stems and clusters of small, blue to purple flowers. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, streambanks, and woodland edges. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a rough texture, while its flowers bloom in late summer to early fall. Hydrophyllum atranthum plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is considered a valuable species for ecological restoration projects.
